.
As we have assumed that an adversary can fully control the malicious clients (and thus the code on the clients), he is not restricted or constrained in terms of the employed attack strategy. In addition to attacks during training, our adversary can also adopt a runtime strategy to make the attack more stealthy.
As can be seen in Tab. 2,
functions optimally against Constrain-and-Scale attacks by filtering out all poisoned updates (BA = 0%). At the same time, the
remains approximately equal to the benign setting

. It should be noted that if the MA is less than 100%, misclassifications of the model can be counted in favor of the backdoor, especially if the model wrongly predicts the backdoor target. As already pointed out by RiegerÂ

, this phenomenon primarily occurs for image scenarios with pixel-based triggers. It causes the BA to be slightly higher than 0% for backdoor-free models. In the case of an Edge-Case attack, the BA before the attack and after
integration is 11.22% and 4.02%, respectively. However, without defense, the BA achieves 33.16%.
against seven state-of-the-art defense mechanisms present in the literature: KrumÂ
. We implement the Constrain-and-Scale attack against all the defenses and compare the output statistics in terms of the
outperforms all these defense mechanisms. These results show that the existing defense mechanisms either lack the precision in removing all the poisoned updates or limit the
of the global model. Further, these defense mechanisms perform accurately when specific assumptions about the data and attack scenarios are satisfied. For instance, in the case of KrumÂ

, which selects a single model as an aggregated model, a poisoned model is chosen when an attacker circumvents Krum. Therefore, the aggregated model is entirely replaced by a poisoned model, achieving 100% BA. Similarly, another defense FoolsGoldÂ

, is effective for the highly non-IID Reddit dataset but fails when their clients have similar data.
It should be noted that
achieved a TPR and TNR of 100% in all three scenarios.

For the IC application CIFAR-10 dataset, we observe that the Constrain-and-Scale attack lowers the MA from 92.6% (FedAVG without attack) to 90.5% (FedAVG). Krum, FoolsGold, Auror, DP, and Median techniques achieve a
of 56.7%, 52.3%, 26.1%, 78.9%, and 50.1%, respectively, which is considerably lower than the benign setting
of 92.2%, which shows that it works significantly better for IC applications. For the WP application, Krum and DP have a decreased
of 9.6% and 18.9%, compared to the highest
of 22.6%. In this case as well,
performs much better and achieves a
of 22.6%. For the IoT-Traffic dataset, every defense has decreased

. In this case, even small drops in MA need to be avoided due to the nature of this application. The reason is due to the high number of network packets in this scenario; even a small number of false alerts will annoy the user, causing them to ignore the alerts. For example, the defense technique FLAME results in a drop of 0.2%, which causes 2 out of every 1000 packets to be misclassified. As a result, when a high amount of network packets is sent, the user will receive a high number of alerts. It should be noted
recognizes all benign and malicious models correctly (

) in all three scenarios, thus, comparatively performing better than the other defense mechanisms such as FLAME. For example, FLAME excludes benign models; in the NIDS scenario, FLAME wrongly excludes 17 benign models, which
might be problematic in the case of highly non-IID data.
Krum and Auror fail to remove poisoned updates in all three applications, as these defenses exhibit a
of 100%. FoolsGold eliminates all the poisoned updates in the Reddit dataset (
). However, it fails to remove them in the CIFAR-10 and IoT-Traffic datasets, as it achieves a

Next, we discuss the impact of two critical experimental parameters on each of the considered applications and datasets in this paper: poisoned model rate (

.
non-IID represents the percentage of non-IID data at each client. A non-IID value of 0 means that the data is independently and identically distributed, non-IID =
implies that the data of different clients differ significantly and are distinguishable. For the IC application, we simulate experiments for both non-IID degrees and

). However, for the Reddit and the IoT datasets, changing the non-IID degree is not meaningful since this type of data has a natural distribution, as every client obtains data from different Reddit users or traffic chunks from different IoT devices. Thus, we only simulate experiments for different
for these two datasets. We will also show the impact of these two parameters on
) and prove that it differs significantly for the benign and poisoned updates.
